metadata.title: CVE-2021-37576 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
arch/powerpc/kvm/book3s_rtas.c in the Linux kernel through 5.13.5 on thepowerpc platform allows KVM guest OS users to cause host OS memorycorruption via rtas_args.nargs, aka CID-f62f3c20647e.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-37576` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-159-generic - 4.15.0-159.167~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-159-generic - 4.15.0-159.167~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-159-lowlatency - 4.15.0-159.167~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-159.167~16.04.1').
